nl.idgis.geoide.util.streams

Interface StreamProcessor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AkkaStreamProcessor

    public interface StreamProcessor
    The StreamProcessor interface provides generic utilities to work with reactive streams. Most operations provided by a stream processor require a scheduler to perform the operations in an asynchronous manner. By implementing the StreamProcessor interface a specific scheduler can be used to process streams. Operations provided by StreamProcessor also include conversions to and from "legacy" streams (the InputStream and OutputStream family).

      <T> play.libs.F.Promise<T> reduce(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publisher, T initialValue, play.libs.F.Function2<T,T,T> reducer)
      Performs a "reduce" operation on the elements in the stream.

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        <T> play.libs.F.Promise<T> reduce(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publisher,
                                  T initialValue,
                                  play.libs.F.Function2<T,T,T> reducer)
        Performs a "reduce" operation on the elements in the stream. Starting with a given initial value, the reducer function is invoked with the initial value and the first element (if any). Then all subsequent elements in the stream are processed by invoking the reducer with the result of the previous operation and the next element in the stream. Returns the result of the last reduce call, or the initial value if the publisher didn't produce any elements.
        Parameters:
        publisher - The reactive publisher that produces the elements to reduce. Cannot be null.
        initialValue - The initial value to use. Can be null, if the reducer can deal with null values.
        reducer - The reducer function to invoke for each pair of values. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        The result of reducing all elements in the stream, or initialValue if the producer didn't produce any elements.

      • publishSinglevalue

        <T> org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T> publishSinglevalue(T value)
        Creates a publisher that when subscribed to always produces a stream containing a single value. The publisher never produces errors.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to return from the created publisher.
        Returns:
        A publisher that publishes only value.

      • publishInputStream

        org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> publishInputStream(InputStream inputStream,
                                                                       int maxBlockSize,
                                                                       long timeoutInMillis)
        Utility to convert a legacy input stream into a Publisher that returns a stream of ByteStrings. The maximum size of the ByteStrings can be controlled usint maxBlockSize. A read timeout should be set with timeoutInMillis. After the timeout expires the input stream is closed and the publisher produces an IOException.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream to turn into a publisher.
        maxBlockSize - The maximum number of bytes to read from the input stream and to send in each ByteString from the publisher.
        timeoutInMillis - The timeout before the input stream is closed if there is no activity on a subscription to the publisher.
        Returns:
        A publisher that publishes the given InputStream as a sequence of ByteStrings.

      • asInputStream

        InputStream asInputStream(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> publisher,
                          long timeoutInMillis)
        Utility to turn a publisher of ByteStrings into a "legacy" InputStream. Reading from the returned InputStream is a blocking operation: the thread that invokes the "read" method is blocked until more bytes become available in the publisher. Use this method with care since this results in blocking operations. The given timeout is used to close the subscription on the publisher after a period of inactivity on the input stream. When this happens the input stream throws an IOException upon the next read operation.
        Parameters:
        publisher - The publisher to wrap in an InputStream.
        timeoutInMillis - The timeout before the subscription on the publisher is closed after inactivity.
        Returns:
        An input stream that reads bytes from the given publisher.
